snippet: The woman killed by a detective’s bullet after she crashed a car in Brooklyn was well known to the police. And the detective was well known to the community.
abstract: Shantel Davis, who was shot and killed by New York City Detective Phillip Atkins after she crashed a stolen vehicle and resisted arrest in Brooklyn, had a lengthy record of charges that included kidnapping, burglary and attempted murder.

byline.contributor: Randy Leonard and Wendy Ruderman contributed reporting. Susan C. Beachy contributed research.

lead_paragraph: The woman killed by a detective’s bullet after she crashed a car in Brooklyn was well known to the police. And the detective was well known to the community.

headline.seo: Woman Killed by Detective Had Lengthy Arrest Record
headline.main: Record of Detective in Fatal Shooting Is Defended
headline.print_headline: Woman Killed by Detective Had Lengthy Arrest Record
